intro: Cynometra zamorana, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, orange pulp. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is often found in moist forests and along riverbanks. The plant also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of timber.
